rComments: This POS is the most sexist and bigoted person I've had the displeasure of meeting. His views on racial minorities and women especially are outdated and disgusting. A truly scummy person. He still thinks like a white man raised in the 20's. The University must be desperate for staff or have low standards if he's allowed to "teach" there still.

Truly awful in every sense of the word. Understands his stuff, but simply cannot suitably convey his point. Frequently talked of unrelated social issues leading to literal cramming of content into a shortened class period. Not at all familiar, nor uses, online teaching tools. Really a disappointing experience that I cannot recommend to anyone.
teacherRatingTags: ['Graded by few things', 'Get ready to read', 'Accessible outside class']

rComments: This prof is absolutely trash and he teaches 3360 at both uottawa and carelton. Unavoidable if you need the credit but if you don't, do not take this class.

Do not take this professor's course, he will never give you any materials used in class, and ask you to complete a 40-page term paper without Rubric. The exam time is also very tough, 90 minutes to do 90 to long multiple choice questions, there is no time to finish!!!

Pros: - Answers emails - Funny anecdotes Cons: - Doesn't post ANYTHING on bright space - Lectures aren't recorded - Poor overall communication with students - VERY vague rubrics - Final had nothing to do with course, many questions were law based (since he's also a law prof) Overall, I'd say the cons outweigh the pros.

DO NOTTTTTTT take his classes. No idea how Telfer still lets Gilles levasseur teach. He's the worst professor I've ever come across in my 5 years at uni. Be warned: he'll talk about everything but the course content, he'll give you 40-page reports to write without grading them, and give hard exams. The 5-star ratings are probably written by him fr

Avoid this prof. Instead of teaching, he talks about poutine, McDonald's, Costco, his personal life and law and doesn't teach anything relevant or related to the class. He had a m!lf bo0bs tab open during class once while sharing his screen. I think I got dumber by taking this class. My poor brain cells, I'm so sorry for them. What a waste of time.

Lectures were full of irrelevant information such as personal anecdotes from when he was a "legal drafter". He did not provide clear instructions for the assignments and posted nothing on BrightSpace. To prepare for the final exam, my advice would be to read absolutely every law and policy regarding lobbying because it will be on the exam.

The exam was about politics and law. It was not from the textbook This prof should not be teaching here at uottawa. He literally accused the majority of the class of cheating on the final. He bluffed and said we can see your screen. We will know when you switch screens or not. Such bs. Brightspace or zoom does not record your screen.

This guy is a wasteman. All he talks about is how he met his wife and how he only talked to her once a week cuz he had to pay a dime on the phone. 90% Of the things that were on the exam he did not talk about in class.

This prof talks about real life stories during class and rarely ever teaches real course material. He does not post anything at all on his bright-space and the exam did not relate to the material he taught during lectures. He is and not very helpful to his students.

Smart professor, but so are computers and libraries. Useless when the information given is difficult to consume given there are no recorded classes, long winded and irrelevant tangents or even posted slides. Virtual learning makes this extremely difficult. On top of that he is generally unresponsive and unclear in his expectations.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Graded by few things']

rComments: Nearly every topic is related to something disturbing in the news (i.e, murder, rape, sexual assault, homicide) I dreaded attending class because of his endless rants. Ex. when learning about corporations he somehow managed to relate it to college boys at Penn state being sexually assaulted. More of a true crime podcast than a business law class.

WORST PROF I EVER HAD. All he does is talk and talk and talk about useless stuff. goes off topics and seems like the whole lecture is about him. Doesn't record lectures and doesn't provide notes. expects you to come to class and waste time w him. he is like one of those controversial people on YouTube to talk about controversies

The worst professor imaginable. Does not post on Brightspace. Refuses to answer questions criticizing his teaching style. Does not provide any slides or PowerPoints based on the content in his lectures. The lectures themselves are filled with nonsense and anecdotal stories from his personal life. He is an egotistical professor.

If you're thinking of taking this course, just don't. If you do despite my warning, show up to EVERY lecture, take great notes, and don't fall behind. His midterm was ridiculous and he has not adapted to online. You can't review your answers on a 90 questions multiple choice and you're not allowed to ask for clarifications. Also a 35-50 page paper!

I have studied here for three years, and I never wanted to write feedback. However, this prof and his quality of teaching made me do it. He does not provide any clear explanation to what are the requirements for the tests and papers. He is not responding to the emails. He does not seem to have any structure in his classes. Avoid this, professor.

Avoid this guy at all cost! Long winded 3 hour lectures where about 2 hours of your time will be wasted hearing about irrelevant stuff. It might have been bearable if this guy didn't have an ego and an attitude. Some anectodes will be sure to come on the exam so listen carefully! Doesn't post slides either! Assignments are heavy and long winded!

3 hour lecture where he spends most of his time discussing things related to his personal life and views rather than content related to social context of business. Does not post anything. Must pay attention to some of his anectodes as they will be sure to pop up on the final exam. Very unenjoyable experience due to the prof and not the content.

Prof. Levasseur was teaching a course on Social Responsibility in business and was a counter-argument to everything he taught. Prof. never posted any slides or information in Brightspace and he did not record lectures, making this course difficult for students in other time zones. Prof posted multiple different rubrics for the same assignment.

I normally don't leave reviews on here but thought I should warn people about this prof. He may be smart and know a lot about the material but has very little regard for students and is not helpful at all. He doesn't care to help his students and is unfair with grading. He bumped up only half the class on the midterm, rather than doing a curve, etc
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Test heavy', 'Graded by few things']

rComments: He doesnt post anything on BS, so you have to attend class. For the 20 page individual project, he posted the outline a week before the due date! If you have a bad team, theres no peer evaluations or grade boosts. The final exam was based on unimportant facts. Regardless, he is smart and knowledgeable, but is not handling online learning great!

One of the worst profs ever. Posts nothing on brightspace, makes you write a 40 page double space term paper, but gives you NO feedback on it or even gives you your mark back. He takes forever to respond to emails . He should just stick to doing interviews and quit teaching.

AVOID THIS PROFESSOR AT ALL COSTS! His lectures had no structure and were filled with nonsense, his assignments (worth 60% of our mark) came with little to no instruction, and his exam was filled with random details that nobody should realistically be expected to remember (after he specifically stated it would be idea based).

This professor was unclear about his expectations for the course. He never replied to any emails and gave no direction for the group projects. He was also against posting any of the course content online, which caused for an unorganized class. It is obvious that he is passionate about the topic, he just isn't good at conveying the material.

A nice and polite guy who cares about what he does, but is a below-average Professor. Lectures are unstructured, disorganized and comprise of irrelevant personal anecdotes. No posted slides or recorded lectures, despite being an online class. Confusing assignment and exam requirements. The exam was alright because it was an MC exam due to COVID.

Doesn't provide ppt or record lectures. I remember more about his personal life than about the course itself. Read the textbook because he doesn't cover a lot of things in his lectures (he also goes outside of the textbook ie. on websites). Gives diff info to diff class. The exam is on the general side (don't need to know specific examples).

Once your behind it'll be hard to catch up. Make sure you read the textbook because he doesn't cover a lot of things in his lectures. Doesn't provide ppt or record lectures. Gives diff info to diff class. I remember more about his personal life than about the course itself. The exam is on the general side (don't need to know specific examples).

Terrible prof; doesn't post lecture slides and rambles on during class. If you miss any of the lectures, make sure you get the notes from a friend! Has a big ego and likes to talk about all the work he's done but is terrible at communicating with students. Doesn't answer emails and pretends he didn't receive them even after you show him proof.

Literally one of the worst profs I've ever had. Spirals off topic and brags about the clients he's worked with and try's to give advice about dating and marriage by putting students on the spot. No clear guidelines for the paper and will not respond to your emails; I sent him 7 trying to figure out what I got on the paper and no response. AVOID HIM
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Graded by few things', 'Tough grader']

rComments: I'm NOT exaggerating when I tell you this is the WORST prof I've had in my academic career. He's off-topic only 100% of the time, does not answer emails, super confusing when answering questions, 0 criteria are provided for projects, likes having low averages,etc. Avoid him at ALL COSTS ,consider yourself warned. If only I had done my research, smh

I am NOT exaggerating when I tell you this is the WORST prof I've had in my academic career. He is off-topic only 100% of the time, does not answer emails, no criteria posted for projects, super confusing when answering questions, ends class super early, and more! Avoid at ALL COSTS - consider yourself warned. If only I had done my research b4, smh
Great professor!

Lectures  No powerpoints to follow  No books to buy  He's all over the place, he can go from business law to why Louis Riel isn't a national hero yet, although it's not related, they are both at the exam. Exams  You will lose points if you DON'T give your opinion.  You will lose points if you DO give your opinion. You will lose points.

Zero lecture slides posted on brightspace, unresponsive to emails, and extremely unclear regarding expectations. He does seem like a nice guy though. I would not take a class with him again though and would not recommend you do.

Absolutely 100% you have to listen to everything he says in class. He barely teaches course content instead grades fully on examples. Assigns group projects and never gives rubrics. Pretty entertaining lectures. Didn't record online lectures or post the slideshows.
The course is unstructured and makes no sense.

In his class we got off topic A LOT, that part sucked... In general you can tell he is passionate about the topics we discuss and he has a lot of personal stories that make understanding some of the topics easier, with a real world example. He doesn't really focus on theory or any abstract ideas in the course, which is good or bad per person.

THIS GUY TALKS ABOUT THE WEIRDEST THINGS IN CLASSS WHICH HAVE NO CORRELATION TO COURSE MATERIAL - HE STARTED TALKING ABOUT PROSTITUTION ONCE AND IM STILL TRYING TO FIGURE OUT HOW IT RELATES CUZ I KNOW ITS GOING TO BE ON THE EXAM

If you are taking a class and see his name under it, here's your warning: DO NOT TAKE IT OR SWITCH TO A DIFFERENT PROFESSOR IF POSSIBLE. He is very unclear about what he wants and constantly changes his mind and does not give proper guidelines or rubrics for assignments. His lectures are also hard to sit through as he always goes off on tangents.
i still need a group for adm 1301 please email me if any of you have spot left. also i have questions about individual project for this non sense course

Buddy doesn't post anything. Not even a rubric for the papers. Spent probably 3 classes just for people to ask questions on the individual paper, this could have been avoided by just posting a short outline.
Does not help students understand any of the given projects or go into detail on the formatting and how they should be done, always goes off topic and does not post any class information.

Worst prof ever. Does not care about any of his students. approached him once, and he was very rude. his tests are hard. His lectures are mainly about his "life lessons" that have nothing to do with the course. I don't think he should ever teach again. He gives no feedback and his assignments have no clear criteria.

We had 3 paper, scored the first without providing feedback, then posted final score without providing the grades for each paper. Online class was heavy, no professional supporting materials ... worst experience ....
A great professor who gives great life lessons.

The course isn't broken down in a way where the very long term paper can actually be sufficiently worked on throughout the year or started early. Provides real life examples though, so the content is far from abstract. Passionate but not the best teacher
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Lecture heavy', 'So many papers']

rComments: Professor LeVasseur is definitely unique. His lectures are fairly captivating, but take notes of EVERYTHING that he says. In his lectures, he will cover purely examples, and will expect you to link it to the material. Basically, if you take good notes in class, and then read the chapter of the textbook and make the links, you'll be fine.

As a reaction to COVID-19 pandemic, Professor Levasseur's online teaching consists of two identical emails which tell us there is a chapter in our textbook that is related to the topic he covered before campus' shutdown. Those emails are REALLY HELPFUL. I WOUNDN'T HAVE KNOWN THAT, IF HE HADN'T TOLD ME ABOUT IT. You are an honorable sir : )

First time 3-hour lectures aren't boring. His class is always interesting and gives you different perspectives. Write down ALL he mentions in class. A tip is to go through and make links with the textbook content. The finals will still catch you off-guard, but that's what happened in all ADM1301 classes regardless of which prof you take.

Hands down the worst prof Ive ever had in my life. Doesnt use bright space, doesnt send any course materials. Emails off his personal email account. I tried emailing him four times throughout the semester and never received a response. He gave us one grade ONE week before our final exam. The final was not representative of the course. Avoid!!!
Would not recommend.

This was the worst teacher I have ever had the disadvantage of taking in my entire career. He teaches you nothing in class that pertains to the final and he doesn't use brightspace. Instead you would think that he answers your emails but he doesn't. I had no idea what my grades were going into the final and there was no way of finding out.

The prof is good at speaking during the lectures and keeps them very interesting. However, the final was complete BS and if you didn't pay attention for 30mins for the whole year you had a chance to fail. I liked him as a person but his tests were not fair or an accurate representation of course material covered.

Worst prof at UOttawa by far. 3 hour lectures are 20 minutes of actual content, waste of time, useless slides. Picks on students. Goes on unorganized rants, don't think about challenging him cause you are wrong. Just read the textbook and use real world examples from the beginning of each chapter on midterm to ace it. Final was god awful! Avoid!!

Countless tangents; expected to understand the links of said tangents to the course material and mandated the use of examples from these tangents on exams when they rarely made sense. Unorganized, horrible at giving instructions for the assignment, unreasonable final whereby most of the class left the majority of applications section blank, AVOID
He goes off tangent a lot and it is very annoying. Buy the textbook and learn on your own because it's more effective than going to class. His stories are interesting sometimes ...

I feel the ratings here are misleading. Firstly, he does not use slides so if you miss miss a class, youre screwed! Second, he speaks fast,goes off topic, and make weak connections on important class material and real life examples he provide. Hence, making note taking a very tedious task and nonsensical. Only recommended if u like a bedtime story

Ended up being my fav prof at uOttawa. So entertaining and it's nice to not have your typical ppt lecture. His grading is fair and he is very helpful outside of class. Make sure to listen in class as he's all about the in-class examples on midterm and final! The paper is long but not hard to do if you give yourself enough time.
Meilleure prof jusqu'à maintenant. Très divertissant, grande connaissance et exemple concret.
One of the best profs at uOttawa. He is hilarious and makes the class interesting. he also cares about his students and really wants you to do well and is willing to go out of his way to help you
Very great teacher ! Very passionate and use real exemple from real life. It's interesting. I would like to have another class with him for sure. I recommend. Very nice person.

Doesn't use slides, instead,all his lectures are real-life examples. There's an adjustment to change to his style of teaching but I found myself actually retaining his lecture 2 years later. Requires you to do reading yourself to get actual definitions and concepts to back up the examples he gives you. I'm undecided if id take a class with him agai

Great prof! He's not your typical boring PPT lecture kind of guy. He keeps you on the edge of your seat with all these crazy real life stories. You need to know these class examples to be successful on the midterm and final. Would recommend to anyone!
Heavy lectures but a great professor. Always gives relevant real-life examples and is very passionate.
Passionate and funny professor! Gives very interesting real life examples to the class topics, and covers content with clarity.
A well respected and hilarious prof.  He will start lectures with little to no warning, so get ready to take notes!
You need to go to class and write every little thing down. His exams have very specific questions. Great personality and you can tell he loves teaching. Always open for questions.

As for the class itself, he goes on lots of tangents and gets pretty off topic. He's a surprisingly easy marker, which is nice. However, if you value your self esteem and self respect, don't take this prof. He singled me out for being an Arts student, and told me in front of the whole class that I would not be able to keep a job in the future.

Professor Gilles LeVasseur is a truly inspiring individual. He loves teaching his classes and provides real life examples to everything he teaches. As long as you attend his classes, participate in the lectures, take notes from what he says and give yourself enough time on the paper, you'll get an A. One of the nicest and more inspirational profs.

Great prof! If you attend every lecture and participate you'll get an A. He seems to grade based on attendance and length of midterms/assignments, so write a long and windy story if you have to in order to fill up your booklets. Not great at conveying subject matter, but write down EVERYTHING he says, you'll need it for midterm and final exams.

Levasseur might be hands down the most interesting prof I've ever had. Don't be intimidated by the term paper, it might seem long but if you give it the time it deserves it's a piece of cake. He is a really fair grader and wants everyone to succeed. Make sure to take note of EVERY example he gives in class because they WILL be on the exam.

Great prof. I had him for business law. He found a way to relate the law to very interesting stories. Class attendance is really how you get the best out of the class. Easy Midterm, easy final, and a good interesting project. Great class.

He is the worst prof I have ever seen in UO. He never told anything useful for the business law. He does not have any slides and never write on the blackboard. He just talks and talks and talks, and just talks many very boring stories. He never has a specific outline to help you understand the law. After his whole term, I really learn nothing..
Gilles is an amazing prof. I would hire him as my lawyer lol. You have to attend every lecture because he used them for his exams.

Do not miss the lectures because every question on the exams need in class examples. The textbook people say are not needed, but it is mandatory for the 50+ page report. Yes there is a very long report. The exams are what we learned in class.

+ easy A as long as you followed what exactly he said in class, especially his examples + easy A as long as your final term paper, final and midterm exam is longer than the average of the class (Just BS as much as you can)  -There is little connection between his examples and the concept itself -Bias -Unorganized lecture -Difficult to follow

Gilles is the best professor I have had in my career thus far. Long lectures fly by and his evaluations are easy enough. Go to class and write down every example he uses. Don't be scared by the term paper it is pretty easy if you give yourself about 2-3 weeks at roughly 1-2hours every other day. Highly recommend.

I've never had a prof that can make 3 hour lectures not feel like death but Gilles actually pulls it off. His class is different from the norm. If you like memorizing terms and topics from a textbook then you may not like him. Everything on the midterm and final are straight from the class, and the paper isn't bad if you start early.

Taught close to nothing the entire class. Told a lot of stories and tests you on remembering these stories. Constantly runs off on tangents and explains almost nothing clearly. Comes in late every class. Literally the worst prof I've ever had in my entire life.
My advice: fluff like crazy... write like crazy
Very Knowledgable professor! funny and tests are general stuff that he teaches.

If you interact with Gilles, he will love you. Raise your hand AT LEAST once per lecture, if not more. Lectures were never dull, which is good because you literally cannot pass if you do not attend. You'll need his stories and examples for the midtermfinal. He can be confusing at times, just ask for clarification he wont mind. Great prof overall.

Guide to an A in Gilles  class: 1) Participate in class and listen to his stories 2) On exam, WRITE UNTIL THERE IS NO MORE TIME (he takes note of students who leave early) 3) On Project, have a good Intro because he won't read the rest 4) Make links to his stories in examproject I had 85 on the midterm, didn't have time to answer a 30% question.

Amazing prof, amazing guy. One that actually teaches the class real information & cares what students think. Every time I asked him a question after class he always asked whether I was enjoying myself. Pay attention in class and take good notes - he talks about news so go to class educated. Be ready to give class examples on exams. Don't buy the tb

One of the worst professors I've had in my university career. Gives analogies for analogies, thus making it almost impossible to relate to the actual theory. Difficult to understand his point and talks in circles. Assigns a min. 40 page paper that is pointless. Avoid this prof at all cost.

Show up for class and participate regularly, he will remember you and you will do well. Doesn't answer emails, no clear grading criteria. Doesn't seem to read tests or paper - but watch him write himself a little discreet note on your papertest once you hand it to him :) Memorize his fake sounding stories and don't bother reading the textbook.
Great prof

Si vous aimez être divertis en classe, ce professeur est parfait pour vous. Ce professeur, ne se concentre pas seulement sur l'école mais vous amène à être de meilleurs gestionnairespersonnes dans la vie. Truc pour réussir avec A: participer en classe, écrire 50 pages au lieu de 30 dans le travail, apprendre tout les concepts et exemple par coeur.
Really awful experience, if there actually is a grading process it's only based on repeating opinions stated in class.

Gilles is a funny guy. Don't bother buying the textbook, or even read it. Write down everything he says word for word and memorize it. Memorize his stories, even if they sound super fake. Didn't answer 1 question on the midterm filled 1 and a half booklets and stayed until the end and still got above 80%. Fill more than 1 book & never leave early.

If you aren't caught up on your tv shows he's going to ruin everything for you. Makes you write a 50 page paper which is ridiculous and gives you no rubric or outline just expects you to pick any topic and write 50 pages. I emailed him multiple times and got no response. Worst prof I've ever had I would recommend doing everything possible to avoid.

He showed up late to 100% of the classes. He stands there are tells his stories (many of which are suspect and looking into them they turn out to include made up facts. Trails off very often. He pretty much 'wings it' every class. You won't do well if you don't know his stories, he asks you to use in-class examples on the exams. Gives UO a bad name

Honestly, i came into this class with an open mind. gave this guy a chance, however, i seriously question how this guy has a job. His lectures are garbage. half the time you are wondering what the hell is he talking about because he trails off from topics very easily. He's all over the place. with respect to the marking, i have no clue how he marks

Doesn't read anything you write, just looks at length and table of contents for paper. Participate in class and chat with him so that he knows who you are. Textbook is useless for the class (just write down word for word what he says) but necessary for the paper. Make sure you get to a second booklet on the final and DO NOT LEAVE ANY EXAM EARLY.
His lectures are definitely NOT boring. But the way he comes up with grades makes absolutely no sense. Gives grades based on how much you wrote and not what you wrote.

He didn't show up for 80% of the classes and someone else was covering for him. Awful experience. He clearly doesn't read the essay you hand in hand as for the final, I personally wrote complete fluff for my short answers and got an A in the class. Easy class if you get lucky in terms of him not wanting a super high average.

If you like to study from the textbook a lot, he isn't the prof for you. Exams are based completely on what he said in class. He talks very all over the place and sometimes I had no clue what he was talking about. Pay attention to current international events/news. 40-50 page paper is boring, get it done early! Ask questions, he'll help you.

My buddy literally only had an appendix for his report (50 pages) got a better grade than me, he wrote nothing on the final and made it illegible. The professor does not read anything you submit, grades you based on how much you make him laugh. Worst experience ever.

"Guys, how are you going to go home and ask your chum or chumette, 'oh hunny, I love you but I want you to sign a pre nup before we marry', you laugh sir? how come?"... This guy is a maverick! The best prof I've had at Telfer and a genuine boss. Easy class for those that actually attend. Make sure he knows you, interact in class and you get an A
He amkes you write a 50+ page term paper but there's no way he can read or grade it since he would have too much to read. The class is interesting, but your not going to learn Business law properly.
Good guy, bad dude. He knows his stuff like no one else. He has like 13 professional designations. Take his class if you get the chance. He's a cool guy.

Probably one of the best classes I have taken in Telfer. Incredibly interesting and friendly individual, but he definately does not mark the tests and report. Midterm and final are fairly easy but write alot! Try to stay for the whole 3 hours and write as much as you possibly can.

Easy teacher if you do the following: go to all classes, ask a question out of class, and write a lot on his paper, midterm, and final. Do not leave any test early, and try to make it to a second booklet. Study the lists and just ramble on during the rest.

Professor Lavasseur is the best professor out there! he actually teaches material that is relevant to the actual world by applying real life examples. Other professors should learn from him, the world is not about texbook theories and concepts. Students should be able to use all the knowledge they are paying for and apply it to actual situations.
This guys is a blast and really funny. Although, it is hard to submit a paper when your not sure if he's going to read it and its 47 pages long.

Wonderful Prof. I highly recommend this Prof over anyone. He not only makes the class class interesting but with relating the key concepts to the everyday life, he makes the concept easier to understand. To get an A, just go to all the classes. Exams and midterms are all lecture notes. Fantastic human being, outside class! Very helpful.

Entertaining. Enjoyed him but checked him out regarding all those designations and he won't even show up as a member in 75% of them, strange. I honestly think he makes up stories like they're his to support an idea. Yeah he definitely Hollywood's it. To clarify got knighted as defender of French language. Course easy to pass and he loves the USA.
Awesome speaker! One of the few classes where I could actually concentrate on the lecture.

I read all the comments, no one mentioned that this man was knighted in 2003. He has 13+ professional designations and teaches at something like 5 universities while owning some "Kernal's" franchises and operating as a crown attorney and the chair of the canadian bar association. People debating whether papers are marked, what time does he have?

Aweful "professor". Goes extremely off topic all the time. Will tell you random stories unrelated to the exam just to show you he "knows" stuff. Turns out, most statistics and dates he will give you are totally wrong. No matter how hard you work in this class, you will never get an A. Guaranteed.

THE worst teacher EVER!!! Very interactive with students and very entertaining. However, he's a total joke! I researched stats and facts he gave us in class, turns out they were totally WRONG!!! And he grades subjectively..he has no answer key, he just skims through your answers and decides on a grade. Also very Vague in all he says!

"You'll get a B" is what most people say about Levasseur. Such an entertaining lecturer! Spent about 15-25 minutes on actual course material during 3 hour lectures. Write this down and that's what you'll be tested on - easy as pie!! Enjoy the rest of the crazy discussions/stories. Term paper was a bit ridiculous. Go on the trip!
Very unclear. Interesting to listen to, and engaging, but goes extremely off topic. Doesn't use powerpoints, and it's really unclear as to what he will actually test on.
No matter how much effort you put into the class you'll probably end up with a B.

RODEO!!! Extremely interesting Prof, although for all the wrong reasons. He's tons of fun to listen to, although I would not call him good at transmitting the course knowledge. It's worth it just for the entertainment. Best part: your grade is completely arbitrary and you will have no idea what mark to expect until the report cards come out!

C'est un prof horrible.  Il parle pour se trouver drôle, on avait à faire un travail de 30p: Ses attentes pour le travail étaient très nébuleuses, la 1ere question de l'examen final portait sur qqchose qu'on avait vu une fois en classe et dont on n'avait jamais reparlé (même pendant la révision).  Incompréhensible quand il explique un principe macr

One of the best prof at Ottawa u, highly recommended. A brilliant prof that keeps you engaged in class at all time. Pay attention to what he says as he may catch you off guard at time but in a humorous way.
All you will do in his course is to write a 35-40 pages long term paper..

Very engaging, able to keep my attention at 8:30 in the morning!!! Calls everyone madam and sir which is very refreshing! Makes you smile, calls on you and makes you keep yourself on your toes and always thinking as you could be the next called on! Very fair grading and helpful. Came very highly recommended - best prof!

Probably one of the most interesting profs I've ever had. For those of you who claim he doesn't correct/let you see your exams, if you take the time to make an appointment with him he's more than helpful.

Very good professor, very knowledgeable about economics. Likes to incorporate alot of current issues and events,which make the class very interesting. pay close attention and always take notes about them, because these issues will appear on the final, and are worth alot of points:)
he would not let us see our tests or works once he had corrected them. many would say that it was not corrected fairly. also we were not prepared for the final exam

Always enjoyed his classes.  Sure, he would get a little off topic with his stories from time to time, but he is walking library.  Incredible breadth of knowledge on a number of subjects, and teaches the course in a way that makes you want to attend and learn.  Funny guy, great communicator.  The only complaint would be his marking style.
This is one of my favorite professors. He knows his stuff well, and he knows how to convey the subjects. BTW, he has 13 professional designations. Unbelievable.

This guy is great. I took two of his classes. He's fair and a nice guy. He knows his stuff and if you have any questions he's always willing to help (but you have to get inline b/c there are too many people trying to ask him for advice). Take as many classes as you can with him.

Very knowledgeable, enthusiastic, loves to pick on students, has good personal stories (some of which are clearly made up to allow him to further a point). I don't believe he reads papers/reports from beginning to end, and he shows strong signs of favouritism. But he prepares you VERY well for exams! You should do well, just go to class.
One of the best profs at SoM.  Very smart man that knows how to teach and get students involved.  He teaches much more than just law in this class...
Not a bad prof, has very amusing stories, keeps the class entertaining!  Fair guy and very understanding!  Great prof!!

Funniest prof I've ever had in my 5 years at OU.  Made every class fun.  Class was in French.

He knows what he's talking about, helps you if you don't understand or need help on your work.  Never a dull moment in the class, relates the subject to personal experiences to makes us realize and understand the subject.

Waste of time. Unclear. Try to avoid.
